title: Running spack with nohup fails with "...'input_stream' referenced before assignment"
body:
I'm introducing one of my co-workers to Spack.  He uses `nohup` (I'm a tmux-er) and found that my build scripts fail (:scream:) under nohup.

We trimmed it down to a simple test case of creating a one line bash script that runs `spack install ...` and then running that script under `nohup`.

```
[hartzelg@lb097hmdev ~]$ cd tmp
[hartzelg@lb097hmdev tmp]$ git clone git@github.com:llnl/spack   spack-nohup
Cloning into 'spack-nohup'...
remote: Counting objects: 74384, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (83/83), done.
remote: Total 74384 (delta 42), reused 42 (delta 10), pack-reused 74281
Receiving objects: 100% (74384/74384), 26.18 MiB | 9.48 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (35361/35361), done.
Checking out files: 100% (2538/2538), done.
[hartzelg@lb097hmdev tmp]$ cd spack-nohup/
[hartzelg@lb097hmdev spack-nohup]$ export PATH=`pwd`/bin:$PATH
[hartzelg@lb097hmdev spack-nohup]$ cat > nohup-test.sh
#!/bin/bash
spack install gcc@5.4.0
[hartzelg@lb097hmdev spack-nohup]$ module purge
[hartzelg@lb097hmdev spack-nohup]$ chmod +x ./nohup-test.sh
[hartzelg@lb097hmdev spack-nohup]$ nohup ./nohup-test.sh
nohup: ignoring input and appending output to ‘nohup.out’
[hartzelg@lb097hmdev spack-nohup]$ cat nohup.out
==> Error: local variable 'input_stream' referenced before assignment
==> Installing libsigsegv
[hartzelg@lb097hmdev spack-nohup]$
```

I doubt that this is what *should* be happening.

Is it expected given what Spack's doing to redirect IO and etc?

Can someone sketch a fix?

**Thanks!**
